title: Wellington 2013 Estate Malbec (Sonoma County)
description: An addition of 7% Petit Verdot gives additional color and heft to this wine. This is a thick, meaty red with firm, robust tannin and use of oak that doesn't impart much on the nose, but surrenders a taste of ripe blueberry and chocolate on the finish.

title: Compañia de Vinos del Atlántico 2012 A Portela Mencía (Valdeorras)
description: Roasted notes infiltrate aromas of raspberry fruit. This feels mostly chunky, choppy and soupy, while herbal flavors of tomato and blueberry finish scratchy and a bit hot.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Victories Rosé of Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: This pink wine, originally started by figure skater Peggy Fleming as a benefit for breast cancer research, shows peach, nectarine, strawberry flesh and cotton candy aromas. There is a touch of sweetness to the sip, with baked orange and lemon curd flavors.

title: Valentin Bianchi 2015 Finca Los Primos Torrontés
description: Shy aromas of green banana, lime and lychee set up a pleasant, lifted palate. Flavors of lime, lychee, honeydew and mango precede a mild, refreshing finish. Drink now.

title: Château du Rouët 2015 Cuvée Réservée Tradition Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The classic skittle bottle shape, familiar from restaurant tables throughout Provence, reflects this wine's character. Lightly peppery and spicy, it has attractive and perfumed acidity.

title: Vite Colte 2015 Aureliana  (Gavi)
description: Delicately scented, this lively wine has aromas of white field flower and a whiff of almond paste. The bright palate offers green apple and lemon alongside tangy acidity. It's simple but well made and refreshing.

title: Voiturette 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)
description: A hint of foliage graces the otherwise fruit-forward bouquet of this easy-to-like Pinot, with core aromas and flavors of crisp strawberry, raspberry and cherry. The tannins are soft but provide a subtle structure, while flavors of plum and cherry skin lend texture to the finish.

title: Wagner 2012 Estate Bottled Meritage (Finger Lakes)
description: Ruddy, rich black cherry and plums are dusted in dark chocolate and cedar shavings in this luscious, juicy Meritage. It's approachable and fruit-forward in style but framed firmly by dense, coarse tannins that linger on the finish.

title: Arrumaco 2015 Garnacha Rosé (Spain)
description: Chewing gum and light berry aromas come with a floral note. Crystal clear and lean on the palate, this tastes of mild citrus fruits and peach pit. Dry on the finish, with a nip of grapefruit.

title: Barton & Guestier 2015 Passeport Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This wine is full of red-berry flavors, fresh with acidity and a juicy texture. Lively and bright with a dancing, crisp character, it's a great apéritif-style wine.

title: Montespina 2015 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Aromas of chewing gum and sulfuric grit lack fruit. This feels wiry and narrow, with hardly any body. Salty, briny apple and orange flavors finish hollow. Overall, this is just a light, quaffable, generic white wine.

title: Ruta 22 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of vanilla, marshmallow and milk chocolate dominate subtle berry scents. This feels grabby, creamy and medium in body, with pushy flavors of clove and woodspice leading generic black-fruit notes. For basic Malbec, this is quite oaky.

title: Ninety+ 2013 Super Cuvee Lot 95 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah, with slightly more of the former. It hinges on large swathes of barbecue smokiness and heaping grilled meat, with a baseline of licorice and vanilla-laced tannin that can sometimes overwhelm.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Florette Rosé (Coteaux Varois en Provence)
description: This soft, fruity and fleshy wine has bright red fruits and a strong pepper character. The wine comes from vineyards between 900 and 1,500 feet on limestone soil, giving it a mineral edge at the end.

title: Ravoire et Fils 2015 Manon Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: In the classic Provence skittle bottle, this is a soft, red-fruited wine. Fruity and crisp, it is refreshing and immediately appealing.

title: Three of Cups 2013 Le Chariot Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is half Syrah with the rest equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. Aromas of wet copper penny and herb are followed by sweet blue fruit flavors supported by firm tannins. The varieties seem to tussle.

title: Tinpot Hut 2015 Pinot Gris (Marlborough)
description: Simple pear and lemon aromas and flavors are clean and appealing, yet lack serious richness or depth. There's a dry, dusty component to the finish that leaves an impression of austerity.

title: Santa Julia 2015 (+) Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of generic red-berry fruits, leather and a drop of vinegar feed into a grabby palate with medicinal red-berry flavors. This tastes a touch herbal on a standard finish.

title: Scott Harvey 2013 Three Stags Red (California)
description: Grassy, minty aromas, a juicy texture and tart cherry flavors add up to a medium-bodied, uncomplicated wine with good balance.

title: Gibbs 2012 Obsidian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This wine offers a punch of deli meat and bacon on the entry, following through on the palate with a meaty, gamey quality cushioned by soft, sizable tannins. The end goes through a phase of bittersweet chocolate and tobacco.

title: El Porvenir 2015 Laborum Single Vineyard Oak Fermented Torrontés (Cafayate)
description: Oak-fermented Torrontés is a sketchy category to begin with, and this example doesn't really help things. Aromas of wood resin, cured ham and pool water set up woody, soapy, resiny flavors. What's best about this is the mouthfeel, which is balanced and braced by solid acidity.

title: Forchini 2013 Proprietor's Reserve Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Notions of vanilla and grape Kool-Aid provide a perception of sweetness on the palate in this soft, nondescript wine from older vines.

title: Framingham 2014 Ribbonwood Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a supple, medium-bodied Pinot Noir that exemplifies much of what is coming out of Marlborough. Hints of mushroom and soy sauce accent bright cherry fruit, finishing on a silky note. Drink now.

title: Gran Passione 2015  Gavi
description: Opening with subtle aromas that recall white flower and citrus, this straightforward white offers flavors of Granny Smith apple and lime alongside bright acidity. It's extremely simple but also clean and refreshing.

title: Le Pépin 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Vin de France)
description: A clean and easy quaff, this offers straightforward aromas and flavors of blackberry, cassis and black cherry, all kissed with accents of black pepper and licorice. The tannins are soft and the structure subtle, with a short but fruity finish.

title: Italo Cescon 2014 Pinot Grigio (Veneto)
description: Aromas of tropical fruit, yellow flower and a hint of nut lead the nose. On the informal palate, brisk acidity brightens banana, white peach and pear.

title: Michel-Schlumberger 2013 Deux Terres Estate Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A unique blend of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon with 7% Petit Verdot and 3% Syrah, this shows soft and chocolaty, with a bitter, herbal undertone that confounds given the generosity of the full body and ripeness of fruit.

title: Michel-Schlumberger 2014 Platinum Collection Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is thick, quite ripe and full-bodied wine rich in baked apple and vanilla custard, the layers concentrated and veering on sweet.

title: Anonymous 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Sharp cinnamon and concentrated but light hibiscus and strawberry notes meet with an extreme menthol character on the nose of this bottling. That minty element explodes on the palate, where camphor and pine needle flavors overwhelm the strawberry fruit.

title: Benmarl 2014 Stainless Steal Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Hints of freshly pressed apple and pear are shaded in savory tones of dust and bramble in this full-bodied Chardonnay. Sunny lemon acidity brightens the midpalate but the finish extends on a slightly bitter note.
